  Mr. Frank Sumption ( most intelligent person in the paranormal field )
  =
I would like to know what your honest opinion of the Ghost Box Hacker
is? o=
r ( Mike's box)
  Can the radio at Radio Shack really do that?
  Because it=
 us definately a cheap device.
  You have opened up the door to new possibi=
lities for understanding the
paranormal,
  and as a person who is searching=
, I hope that you know how much we all
really
   respect and admire you.
  =
 Thankyou for all you have done, and are doing for the future of this
field=
 of study.
   Best Regards
   Debbie Fransen
   debbie.fransen@...

_=
_______________________________

From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
Of purplespacefriend
Sent: Tuesday, February=
 12, 2008 2:05 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: To Fra=
nk S.



I started in EVP wiht white, then various other noise methods, and=
 
eventuallly found EVPmaker on the web. Evepmaker worked reallly well 
fro=
 me, but i kept getting messages realyed from spirits that 
couldn't use th=
e computer, by the ones that could. I was ewondering 
what else I could use=
, and after aobut a week, the whole copncept of 
the box kinda popped int m=
y head fully formed. I think it was my own 
subconcious mind that assembeld=
 information from past experience, and 
presented it as a solutuion to the =
problem. I had worked wijht these 
radio modules from car stereos a few yea=
rs previous, and knew they 
cold be voltage tuned, so I come up wiht an ana=
log version of 
EVPmaker, pretty much. 

Frank-S

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s.com <mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com> ,
"sdudly" <sdudly@...> wrote:
>
>=
 Frank,
> 
> To start off with no I do not want a box. =3D) 
> 
> However, =
I do have a question for you when you have time. I was 
just
> curious as t=
o where you got the inspiration for the box. 
> 
> Was it just an idea that=
 popped into your head or did you have help
> from the other side? Not to t=
ake any credit away from you at all 
with
> your accomplishments with the b=
ox. It was just something I was 
curious
> about.
> 
> I believe I am looki=
ng for personal answers from the other side but
> also I feel it may help m=
e with some more general directions I may
> want to go in after putting my =
own personal demons to rest. 
> 
> Thanks for your time in advance.
> 
> Re=
gards,
> TT
>
